alert.note: Alert for Lander (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 9:40AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Battle Mountain affecting Lander County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Lower Humboldt...including Battle Mountain...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Battle Mountain. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, Moderate Flood Stage. Moderate lowland flooding throughout the reach with a number of rural roads impassable. No homes or basements flooded. Livestock stranding and miring begins to be a problem. Similar to the flood of 2019. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM PDT Wednesday the stage was 10.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM PDT Wednesday was 10.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.4 feet late this morning. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.5 feet on 06/13/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1145 AM PDT.
